_header: In September at the falling of the leaf
Subjects: women, as speakers/narrators; love, courts of
_description: ’The Boke called Assemble de Damys’, ascribed to Chaucer — 755 lines in rhyme royal stanzas, including eleven introductory stanzas and three concluding stanzas

CamTCC599.First Lines:
In Septembre at the fallyng of the leefThe fresshe season was all
                    to gedyr don…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…My felovs all and me must aftyr soonRede well my dreme fo now
                    my tale ys doon
CamTCC599.Attributed Author: By Chaucer (f. 55, added by later hand)
CamTCC599.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the Boke callyd Assemble de Damys (f. 55); Here endeth the
                    book of assemble de Damys (f. 65v)

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
[I]N septembre at fallyng of the leefThe fressh season was al
                    togydre done…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…My felawes al and I must after soneRede wele my dreame for
                    now my tale is done

Longleat258.First Lines:
[I]n Septembre at the falling of the leefThe fresshe saison was al
                    togedre doon…
Longleat258.Last Lines:
…My felawes al and I must after soonRede well my dreme for now
                    my tale is don
Longleat258.Attributed Title: Here endith the boke of / Assemble de Dames (f. 75v)
